net.floodlightcontroller.northboundapi.server
Class AbstractNBClient

java.lang.Object
  net.floodlightcontroller.northboundapi.server.AbstractNBClient
Direct Known Subclasses:
NorthboundAPI.NBClient
public abstract class AbstractNBClient
extends java.lang.Object

Base class for Northbound API client connections.

Provides basic I/O services for Northbound API client connections: interface to message queue for sending messages to the client and must be extended to receive call-backs from the reader thread as messages are received from the client.

Method Detail

receivedMessagefromClient

public abstract void receivedMessagefromClient(org.openflow.northboundapi.proto.NorthboundAPIPB.MessagePB message_in)
This class must be extended to receive messages from client.

This call-back is made from within the connection's reader thread (i.e., no more messages will be received until after this call returns).

getOfCapabilities

public byte[] getOfCapabilities()
Override this method to provide OF-capabilities byte-array for welcome messages.

getCtlCapabilities

public java.lang.String[] getCtlCapabilities()
Override this method to provide control-module capabilities string for welcome messages.

getRegisteredExtensionIDs

public java.lang.String[] getRegisteredExtensionIDs()
Override this method to provide registered controller extension names for welcome messages.

authenticated

public boolean authenticated()
Override this method to receive notification client has completed authentication.

No messages may be queued against a client that has not passed authentication (attempts to do so will be treated the same as a drain-while-terminating condition). This call will always precede any receivedMessagefromClient() method invocations.

NOTE: If this method invocation throws an exception, it will be treated the same as if a false value is returned (connection was not accepted).

Returns:
true if authenticated client login is accepted; false otherwise (connection will be terminated).

matchesTransportID

public boolean matchesTransportID(java.lang.String transport_id)
Determine if the clientID (from the hello message) matches transport level (e.g., SSL peer) ID.

This method is used by the listener class as part of the transport-level authentication consistency check. If the northbound API hello message contains a non-empty

sendMessageToClient

public boolean sendMessageToClient(org.openflow.northboundapi.proto.NorthboundAPIPB.MessagePB message_out)
Put a message in the queue of messages to be sent to the client.

Returns:
true if message was queued for output (does not guarantee receipt).

Returns:
true if message was queued for output (does not guarantee receipt).

writeMessage

public boolean writeMessage(org.openflow.northboundapi.proto.NorthboundAPIPB.MessagePB to_send)
                     throws java.io.IOException
Writes a message directly to the client connection.

This method is normally used by the write thread to send messages to the client that have been placed in the output queue. It may also be used by the reader thread during the connection set-up phase when the client dialog is more controlled.

Throws:
java.io.IOException
